chapter.title: Overview
chapter.para: The purpose of the plugin is to help editing journal titles in the LaTeX coded scientific papers, following requirements of major scientific publishers. This editing mainly means to put the journal titles in a particular adopted abbreviated form.
The plugin is applicable in a particular in-house working environment which implies that a specified LaTeX style is used for bibliography entries.

chapter.title: Features
chapter.para: The plugin makes use of lists of adopted abbreviated journal titles. It allows, in course of working, to create a 'user' list of abbreviated journal titles, when some 'input' journal title is not found in the adopted list.

chapter.title: Lists of adopted abbreviated journal titles
chapter.para: The plugin makes use of lists of adopted abbreviated journal titles. It allows, in course of working, to create a 'user' list of abbreviated journal titles, when some 'input' journal title is not found in the adopted list.

The basic lists of adopted abbreviated journal titles are in their legacy form used in the in-house working environment. This form is kept for possibility to follow the updates of these lists in the in-house environment.

chapter.title: Disclaimer
chapter.para: The detailed description or manual on this plugin is not included in this help.
The plugin has been in use since the year 2008, in its 'rough' but working shape. With this version it is put in a more decent and complete plugin's form.
